skill.name: conflict-resolver
skill.description: Smart git merge conflict resolution with context analysis, pattern detection, and automated resol...
skill.summary: Smart git merge conflict resolution with context analysis, pattern detection, and automated resol...
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional content. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, and no command execution capabilities. All content is consistent with stated git conflict resolution purpose.

content.value_statement: Git merge conflicts disrupt development workflow and waste time. This skill provides expert guidance to analyze conflicts, choose the right resolution strategy, and restore productive coding.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes conflict types including content, structural, and semantic conflicts
Provides resolution strategies: accept ours, accept theirs, combine, or manual fix
Explains git commands for conflict detection and resolution
Offers examples for common conflict scenarios with code samples
Shares best practices for preventing future conflicts
Guides verification and testing after resolution
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly - provides guidance only
Cannot access your repository to inspect actual conflicts
Requires user to apply recommended solutions manually
Cannot resolve binary file conflicts automatically

use_cases.title: Resolve code conflicts
use_cases.description: Handle merge conflicts in feature branches and resolve overlapping code changes efficiently.

use_cases.title: Manage deployment conflicts
use_cases.description: Resolve configuration and deployment-related merge conflicts during release workflows.

use_cases.title: Guide team conflict resolution
use_cases.description: Establish consistent conflict resolution practices and train team members on best approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze simple conflict
prompt_templates.prompt: @conflict-resolver Analyze this merge conflict in my file and suggest the best resolution approach.

prompt_templates.title: Resolve complex scenario
prompt_templates.prompt: @conflict-resolver I have conflicts across multiple files after rebasing. Help me resolve them systematically.

prompt_templates.title: Choose strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: @conflict-resolver Should I accept incoming changes, current changes, or combine both? Help me decide based on context.

prompt_templates.title: Prevent future conflicts
prompt_templates.prompt: @conflict-resolver Our team has frequent merge conflicts. What strategies can we use to reduce them?

output_examples.input: I have a merge conflict in my authentication file. Both branches changed the same function but differently.
output: â€¢ Conflict type: Content conflict (line-level changes to same function)
â€¢ Recommended strategy: Combine both changes (both add valuable functionality)
â€¢ Steps: Open file, keep validation from incoming, keep error handling from current
â€¢ Verify: Run tests to confirm authentication works correctly

best_practices: Pull latest changes frequently to minimize conflict complexity
Understand both branches intent before choosing a resolution strategy
Test thoroughly after resolving conflicts to ensure no functionality is broken
anti_patterns: Blindly accepting one side without understanding the changes
Resolving conflicts without running tests afterward
Ignoring conflicts and hoping they resolve themselves

faq.question: Does this skill execute git commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides expert guidance and instructions. You apply the commands yourself.

faq.question: Can it see my actual conflicts?
faq.answer: No. Paste your conflict markers and code snippets for analysis and recommendations.

faq.question: What conflict types can it help with?
faq.answer: Content conflicts, structural conflicts, semantic conflicts, and whitespace conflicts.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. No code is stored or transmitted anywhere.

faq.question: Why do I still see conflict markers?
faq.answer: Markers remain until you edit the file. Remove markers and keep your chosen version, then stage the file.

faq.question: How is this different from git mergetool?
faq.answer: Git mergetool provides a visual interface. This skill explains the what and why behind each resolution choice.
